DataElement.preferredName: Eye Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions related to the patient's medical history of abnormal eye conditions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Eye Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision. (On-line Medical Dictionary):A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: The organ of sight or vision.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a pre-exist
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a pre-existing retinal disease on ophthalmologic exam?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have abnormalities of the cornea based on history (e.g., dry eye syndrome, Sjogren's syndrome), congenital abnormality (e.g., Fuch's dystrophy), abnormal slit-lamp examination using a vital dye (e.g., fluorescein, Bengal Rose), and/or an abnormal corneal sensitivity test (Schirmer test or similar tear production test)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there evidence of optic glioma, malignant glioma, malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have prior history of corneal ulceration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of or finding of corneal epitheliopathy at pre-study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have corneal epitheliopathy and at the discretion of the ophthalmologist any other eye disorder?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have current or a previous history of sight-threatening retinal disease, including (but not limited to) proliferative diabetic retinopathy, severe retinal vascular disease, and advanced age-related macular degeneration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant corneal disease based on ophthalmologic assessment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinically significant corneal disease in the opinion of the Investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of any corneal or retinal abnormality likely to increase the risk of eye toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the opinion of the investigator does patient have clinically significant corneal disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any other significant abnormality on ophthalmic examination?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.21 AQT added per ticket request. ak
